security: Revealing an American citizen's private communication to Fidel Castro and its interception by the NSA could be considered a breach of privacy and could potentially damage diplomatic relations, as it suggests monitoring of citizen communications.
summary: An NSA document details an intercepted message from a private American citizen, S. Karch, in Detroit, inviting Fidel Castro to attend John F. Kennedy's funeral in Washington.
summary_one_paragraph: This NSA document, dated November 25, 1963, reveals the interception of a message from S. Karch, a private citizen in Detroit, to Fidel Castro, urging Castro to attend President John F. Kennedy's funeral as an act of good faith and a means of bridging the gap between the American and Cuban people; the message was sent from Detroit to Havana on November 24, 1963.
title: 2X/0/ΟΟΥ/T408-63 AMERICAN INVITES CASTRO TO ATTEND KENNEDY FUNERAL
